title: Bread Bites with Broccoli Rabe
introduction: Bread Bites with Broccoli Rabe is a hearty vegetable dish from Puglia that combines tender broccoli rabe with toasted bread cubes. This flavorful dish features the warmth of garlic and a hint of spice from crushed red pepper, making it a perfect first course or side dish to complement pork ribs or chops.
ingredients: 4 to 6 (½-inch-thick) slices Italian or French bread, cut into bite-size pieces
instructions: Separate the broccoli rabe into florets. Trim off the base of the stems. Peeling the stems is optional. Cut each floret crosswise into 1-inch pieces.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the broccoli rabe and salt to taste. Cook until the broccoli is almost tender, about 5 minutes. Drain.
In a large skillet, cook the garlic and red pepper in the oil for 1 minute. Stir in the bread cubes and cook, stirring often until the bread is lightly toasted, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the broccoli rabe and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, 5 minutes more. Serve hot.
